intro: Pedicularis euphrasioides var. labradorica, commonly known as Labrador beardtongue, is a perennial herb native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America. It features erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, arranged in dense clusters at the top of the stem. It thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in tundra and rocky habitats. This species is well adapted to cold climates and has a long growing season in its native range.
